question: The correct sequence of HTML tags for starting a webpage is -
description_correct: That's correct! The correct sequence of HTML tags to start a webpage is html, head, title, and body.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct sequence of HTML tags to start a webpage is html, head, title, and body.

question: Which of the following element is responsible for making the text bold in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The <b> (bold tag) tag in HTML is used to display the written text in bold format.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for making text bold in HTML is <b> (bold tag).

question: Which of the following tag is used for inserting the largest heading in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The <h1> tag is used to insert the main heading or the highest level heading.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for inserting the largest heading in HTML is <h1>.

question: How to create an unordered list (a list with the list items in bullets) in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The <ul> tag in HTML is used to display the list items in a bulleted format. There can be four types of an unordered list: disc, circle, square, and none.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for creating an unordered list in HTML is <ul>.

question: Which character is used to represent the closing of a tag in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The forward-slash (/) character is used to indicate the closing of a tag in HTML.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct character used to represent the closing of a tag in HTML is the forward-slash (/).

question: How to create a hyperlink in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The anchor tag and the href attribute are used to create a link in HTML.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct way to create a hyperlink in HTML is by using the <a> tag with the href attribute.

question: How to create an ordered list (a list with the list items in numbers) in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The <ol> tag in HTML is used to display the list items in a numbered format. There can be different types of numbered lists, such as numeric number, capital alphabet, small alphabet, etc.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for creating an ordered list in HTML is <ol>.

question: Which of the following element is responsible for making the text italic in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The <i> (italic tag) tag in HTML is used to display the written text in italic format.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for making text italic in HTML is <i> (italic tag).

question: How to insert an image in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The img tag and the src attribute are used to display an image on the webpage.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct way to insert an image in HTML is using the tag with the src attribute.

question: How to add a background color in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The bgcolor attribute is used to set the background color of an HTML element.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. To set the background color in HTML, you should use the bgcolor attribute as shown: <marquee bgcolor = "color">.

question: <input> is -
description_correct: That's correct! The <input> tag in HTML is an empty tag used to represent a form input control in an HTML document.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <input> tag in HTML is indeed an empty tag used for form input controls.

question: Which of the following tag is used to make the underlined text?
description_correct: That's correct! The <u> (underline tag) tag in HTML is used to display underlined text. It renders as solid underlined text, but its appearance can be changed using CSS properties.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct tag for making text underlined in HTML is <u> (underline tag).

question: How to create a checkbox in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! To create a checkbox in HTML, you should use the <input> tag with the type attribute set to "checkbox".
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct way to create a checkbox in HTML is using the <input> tag with the type attribute set to "checkbox".

question: HTML tags are enclosed in -
description_correct: That's correct! All HTML tags must be enclosed within angular < > brackets.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. HTML tags are enclosed within < and > brackets.

question: Which of the following tag is used to add rows in the table?
description_correct: That's correct! The <tr> tag in HTML is used to define rows in a table. It can contain one or more <th> head cells and <td> data cells to define a single row of an HTML table.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. Rows in an HTML table are defined using the <tr> tag.

question: The <hr> tag in HTML is used for -
description_correct: That's correct! The <hr> tag is used to specify a paragraph-level thematic break in an HTML document. It is called a horizontal rule and draws a horizontal line.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <hr> tag in HTML is used to create a horizontal rule or line.

question: Which of the following attribute is used to provide a unique name to an element?
description_correct: That's correct! The id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an element in an HTML document. It can be used by JavaScript and CSS to perform specific tasks.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The id attribute is used to provide a unique name to an element in HTML.

question: Which of the following attribute is used to provide a unique name to an element?
description_correct: That's correct! The id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an element of the HTML document. It allocates the unique identifier which can be used by JavaScript and CSS to perform certain tasks.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The id attribute is used to provide a unique name to an element in HTML.

question: Which of the following HTML tag is used to display the text with scrolling effect?
description_correct: That's correct! The <marquee> tag is a non-standard HTML element that is used to scroll text or an image either horizontally or vertically. It can automatically scroll the content in different directions.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <marquee> tag is used to create scrolling text or images in HTML.

question: Which tag/element defines the HTML document's body?
description_correct: Correct! The <body> element defines the HTML document's body.
description_incorrect: Incorrect. The correct answer is D) <body>, which defines the HTML document's body.

question: Which tag contains the meta information about the HTML page?
description_correct: Well done! The <head> tag contains the meta information about the HTML page.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is C) <head>, which contains meta information about the HTML page.

question: Which tag is the root element of an HTML page?
description_correct: You got it right! The <html> tag is the root element of an HTML page.
description_incorrect: Oops, that's not correct. The correct answer is A) <html>, which is the root element of an HTML page.

question: Who invented HTML?
description_correct: Correct! Tim Berners-Lee invented HTML in 1991.
description_incorrect: Incorrect. The answer is B) Tim Berners-Lee, who invented HTML in 1991.

question: HTML tags with no content are called _____.
description_correct: Absolutely! HTML tags with no content are called empty tags.
description_incorrect: Not quite. The correct answer is C) Empty tags, which are HTML tags with no content.

question: Nested HTML Elements are allowed in HTML?
description_correct: Well done! Nested HTML Elements are allowed in HTML.
description_incorrect: Incorrect. The answer is A) Yes, nested HTML Elements are indeed allowed in HTML.

question: Is HTML a case sensitive?
description_correct: Correct! HTML is not case sensitive.
description_incorrect: That's not right. HTML is not case sensitive, so the answer is B) No.

question: HTML headings are defined with the _____ tags.
description_correct: Great job! HTML headings are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags.
description_incorrect: Oops, that's not correct. The answer is C) <h1> to <h6>, which define HTML headings.

question: Which tag is used to display a horizontal rule (horizontal line)?
description_correct: You got it right! The <hr> tag is used to display a horizontal rule.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is B) <hr>, which is used to display a horizontal rule.

question: What is the correct syntax of <hr> tag?
description_correct: Well done! Both <hr> and <hr /> are correct syntax for the <hr> tag.
description_incorrect: That's not quite right. The correct answers are A) <hr> and B) <hr />, which are both valid syntax for the <hr> tag.
